node.Title: Mimic your mental model with Project Collections
node.Description: We’re proud to announce the general availability of Project Collections. Project Collections aims to enable you to create collections of Projects based on the focus you and your teams need, whilst allowing you to perform actions on the Collection.

node.Title: Declarative Data Pipelines with Hoptimator
node.Description: For the last several years, internal infrastructure at LinkedIn has been built around a self-service model, enabling developers to onboard themselves with minimal support. We have various user experiences that let application teams provision their own resources and infrastructure, generally by filling out forms or using command-line tools. For example, developers can provision Kafka topics, Espresso tables, Venice stores and more via Nuage, our internal cloud-like infra management platform. These self-service integrations are typically owned by the teams that build and support the […]

node.Title: Harnessing an observability solution to gain valuable insights into business operations
Monitoring Your Kubernetes Clusters with Datadog x AWS
node.Description: Monitoring Your Kubernetes Clusters with Datadog x AWS September 13th, 12:00pm - 03:00pm CEST Virtual Every day, new companies are adopting Kubernetes as the base for their internal development platforms and increasing the number of workloads that they are running on top of the orchestrator. For their platform teams, learning how to successfully monitor Kubernetes and identify potential issues becomes critical.Datadog is teaming up with AWS for a hands-on workshop opportunity to show how companies can use the Datadog Agent to monitor Kubernetes clusters on AWS.

node.Title: Cybersecurity Professionals: The Unsung Superheroes of the Digital World
node.Description: In a world where superheroes captivate our imaginations, it's sometimes hard to recognize the real-life superheroes among us like intelligence analysts, forensic scientists, and cybersecurity professionals. Yes, cybersecurity professionals! Though we may not wear capes or possess extraordinary powers, our role, especially here at LinkedIn, is crucial in safeguarding our members, customers, and employees from the ever-present threat of cyberattacks. In this post, I want to take the opportunity to explain a bit about what we do as cybersecurity professionals, share a couple of […]

node.Title: How we scaled and protected Eurovision 2023 voting with Pages and Turnstile
node.Description: More than 162 million fans tuned in to the 2023 Eurovision Song Contest, the first year that non-participating countries could also vote. Cloudflare helped scale and protect the voting application based.io, built by once.net using our rapid DNS infrastructure, CDN, Cloudflare Pages and Turnstile

node.Title: All the way up to 11: Serve Brotli from origin and Introducing Compression Rules
node.Description: Today, we're enhancing our support for Brotli compression, enabling end-to-end Brotli compression for web content. Compression plays a vital role in reducing bytes during transfers, ensuring quicker downloads and seamless browsing

node.Title: Introducing the Cloudflare Radar Internet Quality Page
node.Description: The new Internet Quality page on Cloudflare Radar provides both country and network (autonomous system) level insight into Internet connection performance (bandwidth) and quality (latency, jitter) over time based on benchmark test data as well as speed.cloudflare.com test results
